critique: The document is a formal executive order regarding transportation benefits for employees of The Panama Canal during World War II. It is primarily administrative and legal in nature, with no inherent emotional tone. Therefore, the expected emotional response from the American public would be minimal across all emotions. The initial scores reflect this lack of emotional content, with all emotions scored at 1. After further consideration, the revised scores remain the same, as there is no basis for assigning any significant emotional weight to the document.
